website_summaries.verdict: The Brother HL-2040 makes a fine first laser printer. To serve a small workgroup, seek its sibling, the HL-2070N.
cons: Can't expand memory or paper capacity

customer_reviews.title: An ode to my Brother HL-2040, still chugging along for well over a decade
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to take a moment to appreciate my Brother HL-2040, which just efficiently and perfectly printed out a 20 page document for me. I believe I bought it in 2006 or 2007 and it's been with me through cross-country moves and numerous computer upgrades. Sure, my ceiling lights flicker every time I hit print--this little guy must draw a ton of power--but it's been reliable workhorse. In our throwaway world of planned obsolescence, I have to give mad props to any piece of tech that lasts this long. May it last another decade.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Exact replacement for my really old one
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these when they first came out. It printed perfectly for me for about 2 drums and 20 toners. Was still working when I got my first paper jam and slammed the door down too hard and broke the plastic hinges. Went straight to Amazon and found a rebuilt one for less than I paid for the first one several years before. It works great, came with all the test results after the rebuild. I was impressed and still am.
customer_reviews.author: Leland Faber

customer_reviews.title: Fast, fast, and fast!
customer_reviews.text: I got what I was looking for in this printer. It is fast when starting cold, and even faster once it's going. I use an HP 4000 at work, and this printer is as fast as that one! As for page curling, it does curl them a bit (I use regular Hammermill paper), so that's not a function of the paper as noted by previous users. For me, it's not a big deal--the speed and resolution more than make up for it. They don't curl into a circular tube, the ends of the page turn up a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Vet Organics

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I got this printer in early 2007 and it's still working almost 5 years later. I have never changed the toner. I think I paid around $80 for it on Amazon. I don't print every day but I have printed enough where I"m rather surprised that this baby just keeps on printing with no ink-free streaks. I definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a reliable laser printer who doesn't want to spend a whole lot of money.
customer_reviews.author: everythingyoudoisaballoon

customer_reviews.title: I needed a way to beat the HP inkjet cartridge hog...
customer_reviews.text: I only use B/W ..make simple forms and print letters. Ordered on Saturday - came on Tuesday. (thanks all!) It took all of about 3min to connected with my iMac, as the HP inkjet's USB cable worked. Prints quite fast .. good .. crisp. It's louder than the inkjet but runs only a few times a day. The only Negative is that the paper is not flat when done, but I read that here before I ordered it, and for under $100 - what's to worry?! Jim
customer_reviews.author: JimCan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Printer for the Price..
customer_reviews.text: This printer served me for thousands and thousands of prints, always delivering up quality prints quickly and without any pain. It never jammed on me, was quiet and overall a great printer. I would still be using it today but I needed to upgrade to a color laser printer, and had no need for both. This printer proudly serves my girlfriend who uses it even more aggressively than I do, and has also had no problems. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Otto

customer_reviews.title: A great value
customer_reviews.text: I spent some time researching budget laser printers and found the Brother HL-2040 to be the best value. With rebate, its cost rivaled that of many ink jet printers. The print quality and speed and both very good. My only complaint, as mentioned by others, is the fact that the printer slightly curls the paper when printing. If you are thinking about replacing your old and expensive-to-operate ink jet printer, this is a good choice. Your basic ink jet printer will cost an average of 10 cents per b&w copy, whereas this printer will run you 2 cents a copy. I would recommend this printer for light duty home use.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Centracchio

customer_reviews.title: ... one from my old printer so they feed through perfect now. My old drum and toner works perfectly ...
customer_reviews.text: The alignment tab on the front was broken so I was able to replace it with one from my old printer so they feed through perfect now. My old drum and toner works perfectly in this one. It installed itself fine (win7ult). I just had to choose the new one as my main printer.
customer_reviews.author: Intense

customer_reviews.title: The little printer that could.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this printer for a couple of months and use it fairly heavily for a home-based business. Simple to set up and use, it's faster than previous versions, the print quality is excellent, and the unit's price was less than I expected. This is my fourth Brother laser printer. They generally last me three years or so, and each replacement model's a little faster, cheaper, and better than the last. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Lives2read

customer_reviews.title: Best deal for laser
customer_reviews.text: I believe this is the best bang for a Laser Printer. Do not expect top quality prints. Compared to other Laser printers I had before I find that the prints are less quality, they are not as crisp; maybe its the resolution, I dont know, so compare it before making a decision. Also it is more loud than other printers, but well that might not be so important if it does the job. Happy so far for the cheap price.
customer_reviews.author: hymquint

customer_reviews.title: Love it, buy it
customer_reviews.text: This is the best printer I've ever used, and I HATE printers. They're always jamming and infuriating me, while this one keeps going for years. I had to replace the toner once. No problems.
customer_reviews.author: flamingpanties

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I just setup this printer tonight and for a picky person, I must admitt I am not disappointed with this printer. The speed is exceptional, the quality is great, and the noise is minimal. The complaints about noise and paper curling are not something I have encountered with this printer. As for dimming lights during start-up, I have not had that either. For the price this is a great printer. I will give it time to shown how the toner does compared to what Brothers says, I imagine half of the 2600 copies for the normal cartridge will be closer to what I get.
customer_reviews.author: U.S.A.

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This printer is much smaller and somewhat more economical with toner than the similarly priced name-brand printer I replaced with it, but it prints just as fast and sharp. It has not had a hint of the page curling problem reported by another user, so perhaps that user's printer is running too hot or has some other factory adjustment problem. But as for me, I'm a very happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: H. Moyer

customer_reviews.title: Note you need to get interface cable separately
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving it 3 stars provisionally, will revise if needed, based on my excellent experience with Brother printers, but my annoyance that they do not include a basic USB cable in the box (would have cost them about $1 extra, but will cost you $5-10 at least, and a bit of hassle). You will need a USB 2.0 A/B cable (e.g., check out a Startech item that Amazon sells for about $6). You can use a parallel cable if you must, but USB should give you better performance in general, besides being easier to connect.
customer_reviews.author: CSX

customer_reviews.title: nice printer
customer_reviews.text: This has been a nice printer so far. I purchased it just over a year ago when our inkjet stopped working. The printer is quick, prints nicely, and I replaced the ink for the first time just last week. I am a graduate student and do a fair amount of printing, maybe around 20 pages per day on average (some days it's 100 and other days none). My husband also prints but not as often. I bought this on sale with a rebate, making the total cost about $[...]. It's well worth it. Other reviews comment that the paper curls a little after printing. I notice a little of this but it is really negligble.
customer_reviews.author: Fun Momma

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap B&W Laserprinter
customer_reviews.text: Bought this printer when I found out the toner cartridge for my Laserwriter 4/600 would cost as much as this printer. Faster, USB 2.0, takes a little longer for PDF's but not bad. Using this with an iBook and a Powerbook. Was interested in Dell's $99.00 printer, but it's not compatible with my Macs. Others on the board recommended this one, and so far it's performed as advertised! Give them the printer, sell them the toner!!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Cerrudo

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer a year ago and it has never missed a beat. I needed a laser black & white printer for my bulk printing to save color ink on my inkjet. Setup was really easy too. I also use it on a wireless home network and it works just fine. The lights dim when it starts up but I don't mind. You will be fine with this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Hayman33

customer_reviews.title: Very poor performer
customer_reviews.text: I would never recommend this printer. We bought three of these for a school where we worked and all three had quality print issues. They ghost-printed the top of the page onto the middle and bottom. Even after we bought new cartridges, the same problem occurred. I personally have a Brother HL-1440, which is a great printer, so I thought these would be just as good. I was embarrassed when my strong recommendation turned out so bad.
customer_reviews.author: Ron in OB

customer_reviews.title: We bought several
customer_reviews.text: We use several of these printers for our office. Since we decided to standardize on one printer to save on inventory and parts replacement. They have held up well so far, although two are flashing "drum replacement" they still are working. Satisfied with the performance as far as speed and print quality. Initially the print cartridge does not carry much stuff. Once you replace the cartridge you can get several thousand copies out of it.. Not a bad printer for the price...
customer_reviews.author: Ace Ventura

customer_reviews.title: 14 years and third toner. still works fine
customer_reviews.text: I bought it on 08/11/2006. And it is still working today 07/06/20. I do not use a lot, until now I changed toner twice. So this is third one. Third toner is almost gone, And it is still working. This printer is really good. pretty fast, pretty clear, pretty cheap (five star for these reasons) But if you want to print out more than 30 pages at once, it just throw up papers without printing anything. I think it's because printer gets hot after printing 30 pages. If you print 10 pages and let the printer have time to cool down like 10 or 20 seconds, it will print out very clearly without problem.
customer_reviews.author: FrankNYC

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: this is my first Brother printer and first laser printer. was very easy to set up and so far no problems. I had a cartridge ink refill printer before this and was always running out of ink and I didn't print alot. I have only had this Brother laser printer since April 2007. I will come back and review again in a couple of months.
customer_reviews.author: C. hatcher

customer_reviews.title: 7 years later . . .
customer_reviews.text: This was possibly the best electronics purchase I ever made. After years of wasting money buying ink cartridges, I was fed up and bought this cheap laser printer. 7 years later, I'm still printing odds and ends without ever replacing the toner. Tax Return 2011 just printed with clear dark crisp numbers and letters.
customer_reviews.author: JB43085

customer_reviews.title: I really like the Brother HL-2040 even though it is an older
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding value and price. I really like the Brother HL-2040 even though it is an older series
customer_reviews.author: Larry D. Stanford

customer_reviews.title: Voltage Drop Problem
customer_reviews.text: This printer causes voltage drop problems at my office. It turns out that a person in another office put a UPS on his computer and it regularly started beeping. The electricians came out and tracked the problem down to a voltage drop caused whenever the heating element came on. While it is a nice printer and a good value --- the voltage drop caused great problems in the workplace.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Law

customer_reviews.title: For the Price, You Can't Beat this !
customer_reviews.text: - Is it loud? Yes a little bit, but it won't wake you up. - Does it curl the paper? Yes, but not enough to lower the grade in your term apper. - Does it work? Yes, it does work like a charm and uses very little cartridge.
customer_reviews.author: Hans Blix (Pol)

customer_reviews.title: Brother Printer
customer_reviews.text: What a great deal!!!! I was spending $40 - $50 bucks every few months for toner for my old printer. Now not only has the print speed and quality increased but the spending for toner has stopped. A cartridge may cost a little more but the 2500 sheets it prints is 5 times more than the old lexmark printer.
customer_reviews.author: MYJ0611

customer_reviews.title: Great printer, great price.
customer_reviews.text: Just got it today, took 2 minutes to set up. I plugged it into my Airport Express and was printing wirelessly immediately. Ran a few tests and the text is very clear and clean. As others have mentioned, it does curl the paper but not in a really bad way. Envelopes work great when fed through the manual feeder, no more having to unload the paper tray just to print an envelope. The dimming light syndrome hasn't happened to me yet, although it does put out a lot of heat. Well worth it for my needs, now I just hope it'll last more than 2 years...
customer_reviews.author: blauger

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for an inexpensive printer that's easy to set up, this is the way to go. I wasn't interested in color so I have had this printer for a couple of weeks and it does the job quickly. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: If you find one still working, keep it. (old model)
customer_reviews.text: lasted a long time for us, took a lightning strike to kill it. bought the latest version to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Winget

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little printer. We had 2 in the office already, and when we needed another I ordered this refurbished unit. They are very cost effective and easy to use. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: KalyG

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong
customer_reviews.text: You purchased this item on December 27, 2005 and this little workhorse is still going strong. Great little printer! Simple and effective.
customer_reviews.author: R. Taulbee

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have no problem with my existing 2040. Will wait and see on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jim H.

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Affordable Printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this laser printer recently after trying many ink jets. This printer is great.. It works very well with every kind of copy paper. It even prints well on the low quality papers. I like it..
customer_reviews.author: Books To Be Read

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: I use this at work and appreciate how fast it is! Suddenly I need 10 pages for handouts, and there they are! Other laser printers are as fast, but they are not this inexpensive -- $90 at Amazon, which including FREE SHIPPING.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel S. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Brother HL 2040 Printer
customer_reviews.text: Nice printer. Low height...fits nicely in my printer drawer. I've been very happy w/ it. Next time, though I'll buy that duplexes!
customer_reviews.author: Henry W.

customer_reviews.title: Problem with shadows
customer_reviews.text: We got this printer for our home office, and I am having a problem with "shadows" on the prints. Hard to explain but the print is not clean and crisp, it has shadows on it. We tried cleaning the drum and replacing the ink. The shadows just move around, get lighter but don't go away.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Nelson

customer_reviews.title: doing job
customer_reviews.text: This printer does good job. It prints so fast and the quality is awesome that why I buy second one here. The printer preference also simple for setting. recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Jetfly

customer_reviews.title: Works so far
customer_reviews.text: Received during the time frame given. Did not come with a drum or toner though. Printers is working good so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Doran

customer_reviews.title: thank goodness
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad this was available and was in great condition! My old computer can not support a newer additon
customer_reviews.author: cuzi

customer_reviews.title: Best printer w/o color
customer_reviews.text: Best for high quality printing documents. Cheap costs. Long life for 1500 pages on printer. 2500 pages on new toner replacement. Very easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: A. DICOVITSKY

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: It is an excellent printer so far. I use it to print my incoming internet orders and it couldn't be better. You can't beat the price for laser.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: printer review
customer_reviews.text: These are the best... prints forever without buying more ink... no selecting no color.. much easier to me... I have 2 of these... the best!!!
customer_reviews.author: Robertg

customer_reviews.title: Great Printing and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for about a year. It is very fast at printing and the print is very good. I haven't had any problems with it at all.
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful home printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer is great and does everything I would expect it to do for the price. Nothing too fancy here - no faxing capabilities, no color printing. But if you want a printer so that you can work from home, print out school papers, print out directions, etc. this is the one for you. The quality is excellent!
customer_reviews.author: A. Rouse

customer_reviews.title: functional
customer_reviews.text: works well for light printing... printed quality is good and for the price, works well for what we need it to do
customer_reviews.author: SKnip

customer_reviews.title: great printer
customer_reviews.text: Have two of these. Started with ink jets... hated the jets drying out when not used for long periods. Miss the color but not much. this one prints always even after sitting for two months while we travel
customer_reviews.author: Ronald J. Milostan

customer_reviews.title: Brother HL-2040 printer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent in every way. Relatively quiet, quick, good size. Works well with OS X Leopard. No problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Wendy L. Brand

customer_reviews.title: Good value for home office
customer_reviews.text: This printer functions quite well, easy to set up and operate, but don't expect to use it in a busy office.
customer_reviews.author: Wagon Willie

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: Great laser printer for the money. Fast and crisp prints. Highly recommend! Works great on a Mac!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice but noisy printer
customer_reviews.text: This laser printer is fast. It is however quite noisy. The printer pages curl quite a bit. For the price, it is a good economical mono laser printer. The replacement off-brand cartridges are inexpensive compared to other laser printers. Overall, I recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Allan K. Lui

customer_reviews.title: This is a great printer for a home office
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent printer. It's inexpensive, doesn't guzzle toner, quiet, fast, and makes clear prints. What more could you ask for? Easily the best value for the money in small laser printers.
customer_reviews.author: Marco S. Casalaina

customer_reviews.title: Great Service
customer_reviews.text: We've had 3 of these printers. So glad you can still find them as they seem to be the only one that works with our particular mobile desktop.
customer_reviews.author: SWS

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. The only problem I have is, it makes my lights blink. Someone told me it's the frequency it sends out.
customer_reviews.author: B. Cirlin

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Got this printer for my home because I find color printers never work for me after they use up their first cartridges. Prints well -- but it does smell a bit after printing and the lights flicker in my dinky apartment when printing (as mentioned in another review). If it's on sale, buy it, you won't lose.
customer_reviews.author: P. NG

customer_reviews.title: Great little laser printer
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with the Brother HL-2040. It's fast to warm up & print. I share it on a WIN XP home network among three PCs.
customer_reviews.author: DGW

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer for the money
customer_reviews.text: The Brother HL-2040 is a very good printer for the money. Prints fast and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Mulligan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: We wanted something that was easy to use and dependable. So far, so good. It took about 2 minutes to set up and we have not had ANY of the issues we were having with our inkjet type printers.
customer_reviews.author: William A. Piercey Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Less than 10 minutes debox to printout.
customer_reviews.text: This was one of the fastest installations I have ever seen. Crazy! I was going to buy a new drum unit to replace my HL-665 when I looked at the price the HL-2040 was less expensive and had a $[...] rebate to boot. Print quality is excellent. You have to get the manual feeds correct in Word. But, this is an excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: C. Nowak

customer_reviews.title: great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Even though there was a hurricane they got our printer out, it works perfectly and we were able to continue with our business. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Torn Achilles

customer_reviews.title: Printer received as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Received in good condition as advertised. Works great and easy to set up. For our home use only. Pleased with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ade Seller

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: As always, Amazon delivers - product is all it was said to be. Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: ea

customer_reviews.title: good for college
customer_reviews.text: I'm a college student and was looking for a high-quality printer that was cheap and small. This one is perfect: easy to install and connects via USB to my computer, I don't have to spend lots of money on ink cartridges, and it fits under my bed.
customer_reviews.author: Essie412

customer_reviews.title: Some disappointments
customer_reviews.text: Pro. Print quality is good. Con. Paper curls after printing. Paper guides in the manual feed slot do not hold the heavy paper or labels in place, causing paper or labels to feed at an angle.
customer_reviews.author: Marc C.

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Hard to believe a laser printer for less than $150 can be so good!
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Rapp

customer_reviews.title: A lot faster than the HL-1440
customer_reviews.text: I just upgraded from an HL-1440 which died a sudden death last night -- the sheet feeder broke. This one is a little noiser, seems a little flimsier, but boy is it a lot faster. For a $110 -- if I get one year out of it, I figure I'll be money ahead.
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: Owner
customer_reviews.text: The Brother 2040 is a fine machine. The product covers all the bases.
customer_reviews.author: Don Bishop

product_meta.title: Brother HL-2040 Monochrome Laser Printer
product_meta.description:
Detailed item info Product Information The Brother HL-2040 printer is truly designed for small offices or for home purposes. This Brother personal printer easily prints letter, legal, executive, and paper size A4, A5, A6, B5, B6, etc comfortably. With 2400 x 600 dpi resolution, this Brother laser printer delivers crisp and refined images without compromising on the quality. Integrated with 20ppm speed, the Brother HL-2040 fastens the output rate. This Brother personal printer has 96 MHz CPU processor speed, which boosts the printing performance. With 8MB memory, this Brother laser printer stores you needed data and documents. The Brother HL-2040 has a USB port which lets you connect other devices and exchange data with ease. Product Identifiers Brand Brother Model HL-2040 MPN HL-2040R, HL2040ZX1, HL2040ZX1 HL-2040R, HL2040ZX1 HL2040ZX1 HL-2040R HL-2040R Key Features Printer Type Standard Printer Family Line Brother HL Technology Laser Output Type Black & White Black print speed up to 20 ppm Max Resolution (BW) 2400 x 600 dpi Platform Mac, PC, Unix Technical Features Extend Printer Technology Laser Computer Operating System Apple MacOS 9, Apple MacOS X, Linux, Microsoft Windows 2000, Microsoft Windows 95, Microsoft Windows 98, Microsoft Windows Millennium Edition, Microsoft Windows NT, Microsoft Windows XP Home First Page Out Time 10 Seconds Interface Parallel (IEEE 1284), USB 1.0/1.1 Form Factor Desktop Duplex Printout Manual Media Media Type Bond Paper, Envelopes, Labels, Plain Paper, Recycled Paper, Transparencies Max Media Size Legal (216 x 356 mm, 8.5 x 14") Media Capacity 250 Sheets Networking Networking Type 10/100BaseT, Network Adapter (Optional), Wireless Print Server (Optional) Data Link Protocol Ethernet, Fast Ethernet Memory Installed RAM 8 MB Max. Memory 8 MB Dimensions Width 14.6 in. Depth 14.2 in. Height 6.5 in. Weight 14.3 lb. Miscellaneous Release Date January, 2005

AMAZON.COM
Sporting a compact design that easily fits into any workspace, the Brother HL-2040 laser printer is ideal for home or small office use. This dependable unit offers fast print speeds of up to 20 pages per minute (ppm) with the first page out in under 10 seconds. The 2400 x 600 dpi resolution (up to 600 dpi text using Linux) with laser print quality ensures crisp, clear text and monochrome graphics every time you print. Additionally, the generous 250-sheet paper input capacity means you can work more efficiently, while the innovative Web-based user support system helps you quickly and easily manage jobs and troubleshoot problems.

 The HL-2040 also comes complete with a starter toner cartridge and standard drum that print up to 1,500 and 12,000 pages respectively, saving you and your business both time and money. Convenient and easy to use, the HL-2040 sets up in minutes, and boasts an 8 MB standard memory and the versatility to print letter- and legal-size documents as well as envelopes. It also offers USB and Parallel interfaces, is compatible with both Windows and Mac, and comes with a 1-year warranty.

 What's in the Box
HL-2040 laser printer, 1 starter toner cartridge, 1 standard drum.
feature_bullets: Compact laser printer ideal for home or small office use
Fast print speeds of up to 20 ppm; first page out in under 10 seconds
2400 x 600 dpi resolution; up to 600 dpi with Linux
Comes complete with starter toner cartridge and standard drum unit
Dimensions: 14.6 x 6.5 x 14.2 in.; weighs 14.3 pounds; 1-year warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars239 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
